intro: Rubus demissus, commonly known as the lowly blackberry shrub, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a dark purple or black color. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in partial shade. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other Rubus species.
